column4: can anyone help? am not asking to ask am asking because no one replies to me
what is the issue
I want to install SKyStar2 TV PCI card
do the forums have anything about this?
does it work with linux at all?
i found some are for other distros and only 1 for ubuntu which doesnt work

http://www.google.ae/url?sa=t&ct=res&cd=1&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.technisat.com%2Findex381f.html%3Fnav%3DPC_products%2Cen%2C76-174&ei=FUaXSL6TJ4S-wQHzu4yXBg&usg=AFQjCNF-6ePLxIFCgk7854CaH8ktu7wzOA&sig2=H6kRTNNFfA3gBQ9K5jAt5w

seems that some others do in fact support it; checking on ubuntu now
its the most popular tv pci card in the world
which version? 2.7 or other
I wonder where those guys got theh 2.7 version from as it just says skystar2 pci tv
SDK 1.13 (10/2007) thats all the info I can get from their website

someone said in ubuntu forums that all i have to do is sudo modprobe b2c2-flexcop-pci and sudo modprobe stv0299 and useKaffeine to play it.. but no replies  in the terminal after i typed those commands
that is for 2.6; 2.7 is another matter from what the forums say
I wonder what 2.6 or 2.7 stand for as there is only 1 product which is called skystar2 pci tv
two different chipsets apparently; the second you have to compile the drivers for
hmm probably because one is chinese or from taiwan and the other one is german
any luck
empathy should be able to handle qq
